columns.description: The filing type of the application

columns.description: The overall status of the filing

columns.description: The date the application was submitted

columns.description: The type of work included in the application

columns.description: Building Identification Number assigned by Department of City Planning

columns.description: The house number for the building owner's address.

columns.description: The street name for the building owner's address.

columns.description: A number to indicate the NYC borough where the proposed work will take place

columns.name: Proposed Work Summary
columns.description: Freeform text description of work to be performed

top.item: ON THE 1ST FL, REPLACE ON EXISTING ROUGHING (1) STOVE & FLEX (METER IS EXISTING) GAS VALVE NOT TO BE TOUCHED. FIRESTOPS WILL NOT BE COMPROMISED.
ON THE 2ND FL, REPLACE ON EXISTING ROUGHING (1) STOVE & FLEX (METER IS EXISTING) GAS VALVE NOT TO BE TOUCHED. FIRESTOPS WILL NOT BE COMPROMISED.
INSTALLATION OF A TEMPORARY MOBILE STEAM TRAILER OUTSIDE THE BUILDING TO PROVIDE TEMPORARY HEAT AND HOT WATER. MOBILE BOILER IS A 100HP BOILER REGISTRATION #MD161161 06.

Disconnect septic system, destroy tank and, pit and disinfect. Fill with clean sand. Install new X.H.C.I sewer house drain to curb connection 10 inches of 6 inches pipe and approximately 15 inches of 4 inches pipe.
ON THE 3RD FL, REPLACE ON EXISTING ROUGHING (1) STOVE & FLEX (METER IS EXISTING) GAS VALVE NOT TO BE TOUCHED. FIRESTOPS WILL NOT BE COMPROMISED.
Gas to this building has been shut down and locked by utility for a gas leak of unknown origin. Test to ascertain scope of work and make necessary repairs to restore essential services.
IN CELLAR, INSTALL APPROX 30 feet OF 2 inches AND APPROX 30 feet OF 3 inches WASTE PIPE FROM ELEVATOR SUMP PUMP TO EXISTING WASTE LINE. FIRESTOPS WILL NOT BE COMPROMISED.
GAS LEAK & SHUTDOWN. TEST EXISTING GAS LINE FOR HEAT, HOT WATER & COOKING. MAKE NECESSARY REPAIRS. WE WILL REGISTER EQUIPMENT.

IN THE CELLAR, REPLACE (64) 1/2 inches DRAIN VALVES, (32) 1 inches WATER RISER VALVES AND (32) 3/4 inches WATER RISER VALVES THROUGHOUT COMPLEX. SEPARATE LAA feetS TO BE FILED FOR EACH BIN#. FIRESTOPS WILL NOT BE COMPROMISED.
Remove defective/leaking pool heater gas piping and replace it with new.  Register pool heater.

REPLACE DEFECTIVE COOKING GAS PIPING WITH APPX  40 FEET OF 2 inches& 3/4 inches BLK STEEL GAS  PIPING IN 1ST FLOOR CRAWLSPACE, REPLACE (2) 3/4 inches VALVES/FLEXES FOR APT STOVES APT 1A AND 2B  .METER LOCATED IN CELLAR OF 68-46 136TH ST. NO CELLAR OR BSMT APTS. GAS FOR COOKING ONLY  NO GAS IN PUBLIC AREAS, FIRESTOPPING WILL NOT BE COMPROMISED

gas shut down due to fire in apt by FDNY replace (2) 3/4 inches gas valves & flex in each apt.  garden apts 1 apt each flr (2 apts total), test gas for cooking, meter located in 196-64 69th Avenue bldg. , gas  piping replaced @ 196-64 69th under job#Q00349461, no gas piping in public hallways, stairwells and/or shafts  firestopping will not be compromised.

DUE TO LEAK ON EXTENSION SERVICE & GAS SHUTDOWN TEST EXISTING GAS LINE FOR COOKING ONLY IN (2) RESIDENTIAL GARDEN APTS- #1 & #2 (FLS 1 & 2) REMOVE (1) RISER VALVE & INSTALL (2) 1 inches L/W VALVES AT THE BASE OF RISERS & REPLACE APPROX 8 feet OF 1 inches GAS PIPE & FITTINGS IN CELLAR. REPLACE GAS VALVE BEHIND EACH EXISTING STOVE. EXISTING COMMON METER LOCATED AT 71-41 252 STREET. FIRESTOPS WILL NOT BE COMPROMISED.

REPLACE DEFECTIVE COOKING GAS PIPING WITH APPX  40 FEET OF 2 inches& 3/4 inches BLK STEEL GAS  PIPING IN 1ST FLOOR CRAWLSPACE AND IN KIND THROUGHOUT KITCHENS IN BLDG APT 1A AND 2B, REPLACE (2) 3/4 inches VALVES/FLEXES FOR APT STOVES .METER LOCATED IN CELLAR OF 136-05 68TH DRIVE. NO CELLAR OR BSMT APTS. GAS FOR COOKING ONLY  NO GAS IN PUBLIC AREAS, FIRESTOPPING WILL NOT BE COMPROMISED

Due to utility gas turn off, we will test piping and make the repairs necessary to alleviate the hazardous condition to restore gas to the site. No gas piping in public hallways. Firestops if required, will be restored as per NYC code.
Gas to this building has been shut down due to a gas leak of unknown origin. Test to ascertain scope of work and make necessary repairs to restore essential services.
In 1st floor mechanical room replace approximately 20ft of 3 inches & 2 inches copper domestic hot and cold water piping with associated fittings & valves.
REARRANGE APPROX. 10LF OF 1 SPRINKLER PIPING AND (2)SPRINKLER HEADS IN CELLAR TO ACCOMMODATE NEW TRASH COMPACTOR,WITH NO CHANGE OF USE OF OCCUPANCY, MEANS OF EAGRESS OR COVERAGE.
REQUESTING EWN FOR DIRECT REPLACEMENT OF GAS FIRED HOT WATER HEATER IN CELLAR. LAA TO FOLLOW WITHIN TWO DAYS.

cachedContents.smallest: 001, 002, 003,004, 005, 006 - REPLACE PAINTED SPRINKLER HEADS WITH THIRTY [30]  NEW SPRINKLER HEADS.  5 SPRINKLER HEADS WILL BE REPLACED ON EACH OF THE ABOVE DESCRIBED FLOORS. SPRINKLER HEADS TO BE THE SAME SIZE AND TYPE AS EXISTING. SPRINKLER SYSTEM TO BE SHUT FOR APPROX. FIVE [5] HOURS. WILL NOTIFY FDNY OF SYSTEM SHUT DOWN AND RESTORATION.

options: City Clerk & Clerk of the Council (OCC)
Department of Consumer and Worker Protection (DCWP)
Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH)
Department of Housing Preservation and Development (HPD)

Department of Youth and Community Development (DYCD)
Fire Department Pension Fund & Related Funds
Fire Department of New York City (FDNY)
Mayor's Office of Climate and Environmental Justice (MOCEJ)
Mayor's Office of Climate and Sustainability
Mayor's Office of Ethnic and Community Media (MOECM)
Mayor's Office of Housing Recovery Operations (HRO)
Mayor's Office of Media And Entertainment (MOME)
Mayor's Office of Recovery and Resiliency
Mayor's Office of the Chief Technology Officer (MOCTO)
Mayor’s Office of Community Mental Health (OCMH)
Mayor’s Office to End Domestic and Gender-Based Violence
Office of Administrative Trials and Hearings (OATH)
Office of Citywide Event Coordination and Management (CECM)
Office of Film, Theatre, and Broadcasting (FILM)
Port Authority of New York & New Jersey (PANYNJ)
Public Design Commission (formerly Art Commission (ARTCOM) and Design Commission)
fields.name: Agency

view.description:
The Limited Alteration Application (LAA) is used for plumbing work, fire suppression piping replacement and repairs, and oil burner installations that do not include construction work. Generally, with the exception of some new installations, LAAs are restricted to repair and/or replacement work for existing appliances and piping systems that do not require a Professional Engineer (PE) or a Registered Architect (RA).


https://www1.nyc.gov/site/buildings/industry/limited-alteration-application.page
view.emailShareUrl: mailto:?subject=DOB NOW: Build – Limited Alteration Applications&body=Here is a dataset from NYC Open Data that I would like to share with you: https%3A%2F%2Fdata.cityofnewyork.us%2FHousing-Development%2FDOB-NOW-Build-Limited-Alteration-Applications%2Fxxbr-ypig

Generally, with the exception of some new installations, LAAs are restricted to repair and/or replacement work for existing appliances and piping systems that do not require a Professional Engineer (PE) or a Registered Architect (RA).
